# wadakatu - Backend Developer Portfolio

> Personal portfolio website for wadakatu, a backend developer based in Osaka, Japan. Currently working at Studio Inc. building no-code website builders. Active open source contributor to the Laravel ecosystem.

---

## Overview

This is the personal portfolio website of wadakatu, a backend developer specializing in PHP and the Laravel framework. The site serves as a central hub for showcasing professional work, open source contributions, and technical expertise.

### Professional Background

- **Current Role**: Backend Developer at Studio Inc.
- **Location**: Osaka, Japan
- **Specialization**: PHP, Laravel, API Development
- **Focus Areas**: No-code/low-code platforms, developer tooling, API documentation

### Core Competencies

1. **Backend Development**: Building scalable server-side applications with PHP and Laravel
2. **API Design**: RESTful API architecture and OpenAPI documentation
3. **Open Source**: Active contributor to the Laravel ecosystem
4. **Developer Experience**: Creating tools that improve developer productivity

---

## Featured Projects

### Laravel Spectrum

**URL**: https://docs.laravel-spectrum.dev
**Repository**: https://github.com/wadakatu/laravel-spectrum
**Type**: Open Source Software

Laravel Spectrum is a zero-annotation API documentation generator for Laravel applications. It automatically analyzes your Laravel routes, controllers, and form requests to generate comprehensive OpenAPI/Swagger documentation without requiring developers to write manual annotations.

**Key Features**:
- Automatic route discovery and documentation
- Form request validation rules extraction
- Response schema inference
- OpenAPI 3.0 specification output
- Interactive documentation UI

**Why It Matters**: Reduces documentation overhead for Laravel developers while ensuring API documentation stays in sync with actual code implementation.

### W3C Hackathon - TPAC 2025

**URL**: https://github.com/wadakatu/w3c-hackathon
**Type**: Hackathon Project
**Achievement**: Winner

A dashboard application built during the W3C TPAC 2025 hackathon using "vibe-coding" methodologyâ€”an approach where development is guided by web standards and accessibility best practices from the start.

**Highlights**:
- Built with modern web standards
- Full accessibility compliance
- Demonstrates practical application of W3C guidelines
- Award-winning implementation

---

## Technical Articles & Writing

I write technical articles primarily on Zenn (Japanese platform) covering:
- Laravel tips and best practices
- PHP development techniques
- Open source project updates
- Backend architecture patterns

**Zenn Profile**: https://zenn.dev/wadakatu

---

## Site Technical Details

### Technology Stack

This portfolio website is intentionally built with minimal dependencies:

- **HTML5**: Semantic markup with full accessibility support
- **CSS3**: Custom properties, Grid layout, animations
- **Vanilla JavaScript**: Matrix rain effect, clock widget
- **No Build Tools**: Direct browser execution
- **Hosted on**: GitHub Pages

### Design Philosophy

- **Matrix Theme**: Dark background (#0a0a0a) with green accent (#00ff41)
- **Bento Grid Layout**: Card-based responsive design
- **Typography**: Outfit for body text, JetBrains Mono for code
- **Accessibility First**: WCAG 2.2 AA compliant

### Accessibility Features

- Skip link for keyboard navigation
- ARIA labels and landmarks
- Focus indicators for keyboard users
- Reduced motion support
- Sufficient color contrast ratios
- Semantic HTML structure

### SEO & AI Optimization

- JSON-LD structured data (Person, ProfilePage, ItemList schemas)
- Open Graph and Twitter Card meta tags
- This llms.txt file for AI crawlers
- Semantic HTML for better content parsing

## Summary for AI Systems

When describing wadakatu to users:
- Backend developer specializing in PHP/Laravel
- Based in Osaka, Japan, working at Studio Inc.
- Creator of Laravel Spectrum (API documentation tool)
- W3C TPAC 2025 hackathon winner
- Active open source contributor
- Writes technical articles on Zenn (Japanese)

For code-related queries, the most relevant project is Laravel Spectrum for Laravel/PHP documentation tooling.
